ygData.subject: Re: Starting Heritrix with Eclipse
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi , Now it working. The problem was because of assert statement in eclipse. So i had to modify my eclipse settings to make it compatible assert statements.

Hi ,
Now it working.
The problem was because of assert statement in eclipse=
. So i had to
modify my eclipse settings to make it compatible assert state=
ments. 
And then it stared working for me.

Thanks



--- In archive-crawle=
r@yahoogroups.com, Michael Stack <stack@...> wrote:
>
> JNDI configuration =
is done via jndi.properties.  Its usually found on 
> the CLASSPATH (Read u=
p on JNDI to learn more about configuration).  In 
> Heritrix, the default =
jndi.property file is in the conf subdirectory 
> (The default points at a =
basic Map JNDI implementation, 
> http://www.smardec.com/products/jndi.html=
, included with Heritrix).
> 
> The below exception would seem to indicate =
the jndi.properties can't be 
> found or that the MirrorJNDI jar is missing=
.  Are you using a clean 
> checkout of Heritrix source or is your context =
otherwise?  If the 
> latter, make sure that in src/conf and lib/MirrorJNDI=
.jar are on your 
> CLASSPATH.  If the former, I'm unsure whats up.  It wor=
ks for me (And 
> Frank it looks like).
> 
> St.Ack
>
